title: This is what to do if you're attacked by a dog - according to a Navy SEAL
text:
It's unlikely you will be attacked by a dog, but here's what to do in case it does happen Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The last decade has seen an increase in the number of dog attacks by as much as 76 per cent. 
Of the number of fatalities, the majority were children. 
What lies at the root of this increase - as well as the reported rise in general canine aggression - is varied, and includes training issues, pet ownership legislation and amendments to the Dangerous Dogs Act. 
Despite the surge in the number of dog attacks, they do remain the exception rather than the rule. 
A dog behaving aggressively is extremely daunting and frightening and should it ever escalate and you find yourself being PHYSICALLY attacked, here's what you should do. 
Author and former Navy SEAL Clint Emerson spoke to Business Insider with his potentially life-saving pointers. 1. Guard yourself. 
Take your shirt, jacket, whatever you have - even a bag or a purse - and give it to the dog to go after so it's not after any other vital part of your body. Dog attacks are said to to be on the rise (Photo: Moment RF) 2. Take your shirt off. 
And put it around your arm. You want to protect where the ulnar and radius (the bones in your forearm) flow because that's where your major arteries are. 
So if you are giving the dog your arm in defence, give them your forearm, not the inside, which is where the vital arteries are. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
